titles.title: United States Product Integration Incentive Act of 1987
A bill to provide preferential treatment on imported products assembled or processed from articles grown, produced, or manufactured in the United States.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. United States Product Integration Incentive Act of 1987 - Prohibits any quantity limitation on that portion of the product assembled or processed from articles grown, produced, or manufactured in the United States. Provides that this Act shall not constitute a modification to category quotas designated for countries participating in bilateral agreements with the United States pursuant to the Multi-Fiber Arrangement for textiles and textile products, except for the prohibition contained within this Act.
